statements: DROP SEQUENCE IF EXISTS orders.seqs.seq1
DROP SEQUENCE IF EXISTS orders.seqs.seq2
DROP SEQUENCE IF EXISTS orders.seqs.seq3
DROP SEQUENCE IF EXISTS orders.seqs.seq4
CREATE SEQUENCE orders.seqs.seq1
CREATE SEQUENCE orders.seqs.seq2 WITH {"increment":-1}
CREATE SEQUENCE orders.seqs.seq3 START WITH 1000 MINVALUE 999 MAXVALUE 1001 CYCLE
CREATE SEQUENCE orders.seqs.seq4 START WITH 2000 MAXVALUE 2002 NO CYCLE
SELECT NEXT VALUE FOR orders.seqs.seq1 sv, t FROM array_range(0,5) t
SELECT NEXT VALUE FOR orders.seqs.seq2 sv FROM array_range(0,5) t
SELECT NEXT VALUE FOR orders.seqs.seq3 sv FROM array_range(0,3) t
SELECT NEXT VALUE FOR orders.seqs.seq4 sv FROM array_range(0,5) t
BEGIN WORK
INSERT INTO orders VALUES(TO_STRING(NEXTVAL FOR orders.seqs.seq1),{"id":NEXTVAL FOR orders.seqs.seq1,"test_id":"seq"})
INSERT INTO orders VALUES(TO_STRING(NEXTVAL FOR orders.seqs.seq1),{"id":PREVVAL FOR orders.seqs.seq1,"test_id":"seq"})
INSERT INTO orders(KEY k,VALUE v) SELECT TO_STRING(NEXTVAL FOR orders.seqs.seq1) k,{"id":NEXTVAL FOR orders.seqs.seq1,"test_id":"seq"} v
COMMIT
SELECT meta().id,* FROM orders WHERE test_id = 'seq'
ALTER SEQUENCE orders.seqs.seq1 RESTART WITH 100

SELECT *, y, NEXT VALUE FOR orders.seqs.seq1 nv1, NEXT VALUE FOR orders.seqs.seq1 nv2, x FROM array_range(0,3) t LET x = NEXT VALUE FOR orders.seqs.seq1 ,y = (SELECT PREV VALUE FOR orders.seqs.seq1 a, NEXT VALUE FOR orders.seqs.seq1 b FROM array_range(0, 2) tt, t for_correlation) ORDER BY t
